value.title: SQL Service Principal Names
value.excerpt: A look at how the SQL SPN's should be formatted and how they get generated.  This was based on an older blog I had published and I still get a lot of questions on this.  What SPN do I use and how does it get there? - http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2010/03/09/what-spn-do-i-use-and-how-does-it-get-there.aspx

value.title: The Tale of Two Caches
value.excerpt: Want to optimize performance in Power BI? Of course, you do! In order to do that, you need to understand the two caches that are at play and how they affect your optimization efforts. Marco Russo helps explain!  DAX Studio 3 https://daxstudio.org  Connect with SQLBI: Website: https://sqlbi.com YouTube:

value.title: Tools to take Power BI to the NEXT LEVEL

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how you can trace your DAX queries when trying to troubleshoot or optimize Power BI reports and datasets. There are a few options and Adam walks you through them. value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. value.title: Why isn't my Agg hitting when using DISTINCTCOUNT in Power BI???
value.excerpt: Using Aggregations in Power BI? Have some DISTINCTCOUNT in your measures? Wondering why the queries are slow and not hitting the aggs? Patrick shows you what is going on! Get ready for some DAX fusion!  DAX Fusion: https://dax.tips/2019/08/05/dax-fusion/  Aggregations Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/aggregations-advanced

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups.
